articles.title: Stop Lazy Loading Product and Hero Images
articles.description: Jason highlights a performance issue seen on many ecommerce sites around lazy loading usage, particularly its overuse: ‚ÄúLazy loading is a key technique when it comes to increasing page performance, but like any technique, it shouldn‚Äôt be applied everywhere‚Äù.

articles.title: W3C Introduces Web Sustainability Guidelines
articles.description: From the Sustainable Web Design Community Group comes a set of guidelines on Sustainable Web Design, explaining how to design and build ‚Äúdigital products and services that put people and the planet first‚Äù. You can read the draft here.
articles.author: W3C

articles.title: Web Components Accessibility FAQ
articles.description: Manuel runs through the most important questions regarding web component accessibility, including dependencies, shadow DOM queries, custom elements, and more.
articles.author: Manuel Matuzoviƒá

articles.title: üíõ ¬†Memories of Molly
articles.description: Last week we shared the sad news that Molly Holzschlag passed away, here Eric Meyer reflects on her memory. Others in the web community have also shared their thoughts on Molly, including words from Jay Hoffmann, Bruce Lawson, Aaron Gustafson, and Deborah Edwards-O√±oro.

articles.title: How to Make Charts and Graphs More Accessible
articles.description: Some solid pointers on how to make your visual data accessible and more usable.
articles.author: Whitney Lewis

articles.title: Creating Custom Easing Effects in CSS Animations with¬†linear()
articles.description: This CSS timing function enables custom easing in animations. Here‚Äôs a look at how it works compared with other timing functions used for easing, along with practical examples.

articles.title: The New Google Fonts: Finding What You‚Äôre Looking for

articles.title: Scroll-Driven Animations Debugger: A DevTools Extension
articles.description: A new Chrome DevTools extension specifically to visualize and debug scroll-driven animations.

articles.title: unpic/placeholder: A Library for Generating Pure CSS Image Placeholders
articles.description: This is done by extracting the dominant color from an image or by server-side rendering a BlurHash value, which then is used to display a temporary image during load time.
articles.author: Matt Kane

articles.title: qr-code: Web Component for Animatable SVG-Based QR¬†Codes
articles.description: We‚Äôre not entirely sure why you‚Äôd want to animate a QR code, but the effects are pretty neat. You can try out the demo here.

articles.title: CSS Loaders: A Collection of 500+ Loading Animations
articles.description: This is a huge collection of animated single-element CSS-only loaders. You‚Äôre bound to find one that suits your project here.

articles.title: BlendIcons: 140K+ Free Icons in Various Categories and Styles
articles.description: A simple UI lets you search via keyword and you can filter by icon styles (bold, filled, etc.). Each icon is available in different formats including SVG, PNG, JSX, CSS, HTML, Base64, etc.

articles.title: Crop Video: Online Tool to Quickly Crop a Video File

articles.title: React Plock: A 1KB Masonry Grid Component

articles.title: Run Lighthouse on PageSpeed Insights Against a Set of URLs
articles.description: You'll need Node.js, but this will let you see which of the sites you supply is fastest. In other words, something like ‚ÄúAmazing Race‚Äù for websites?

articles.description: What were the "no-no's" of web design in 1999? Jakob Nielsen shared what he deemed the top ten mistakes you could make from a usability perspective. Helpful insights that still mostly stand up today.
WOFF may have left the building as a web font format, but long live WOFF2!
WordPress has an interesting new 100-year plan to help you secure your 'online legacy for a lifetime'. It's not cheap.
Chrome is getting a bit of a new look based on Google's 'Material You' design language.
Version 15 of developer browser Polypane is out, running on Chromium 116, with a new browser panel, performance improvements, and more.
